text.section:
After notice and a hearing, the Commissioner may assess a civil penalty against a banking institution that the Commissioner determines has:
Violated a cease and desist order issued by the Commissioner under § 5-808 of this subtitle; or
Engaged in:
An unsafe or unsound banking practice; or
A practice that is injurious to the public interest.

The civil penalty may not exceed:
$1,000 per violation; and
$1,000 per violation for each day that the violation continues.

section.section: A civil penalty shall be assessed by written notice of assessment served on the person to be assessed.

The notice of assessment shall state the:
Amount of the civil penalty;
Legal authority for the assessment; and
Matters of fact or law constituting the grounds for the assessment.
The notice of assessment shall constitute a final order for purposes of judicial review pursuant to § 10-221 of the State Government Article.
A civil penalty assessed under this section shall be due and payable within 30 days after the Commissioner issues the notice of assessment.
The Commissioner may reduce or set aside a civil penalty.

text.section: The Commissioner shall pay all civil penalties collected under this section into the General Fund of the State.
